metadata.title: CVE-2016-10040 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in QXmlSimpleReader in Qt 4.8.5 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a xml filewith multiple nested open tags.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10040` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libqt5concurrent5 - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
libqt5core5a - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
libqt5dbus5 - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
libqt5gui5 - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
libqt5libqgtk2 - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
libqt5network5 - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
libqt5opengl5 - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
libqt5printsupport5 - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
libqt5sql5 - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
libqt5sql5-mysql - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
libqt5sql5-odbc - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5

libqt5sql5-sqlite - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
libqt5sql5-tds - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
libqt5test5 - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5

qtbase5-examples - 5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5
No subscription required

libqt4-dbus - 4:4.8.7+dfsg-5ubuntu2

criterions.comment: qtbase-opensource-src package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.5.1+dfsg-16ubuntu7.5').
qt4-x11 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.8.7+dfsg-5ubuntu2').
